content.webTitle: Tesco is still UK's top retail brand despite horsemeat scandal, says report

fields.headline: Tesco is still UK's top retail brand despite horsemeat scandal, says report
fields.bodyText: Tesco may have arguably been the hardest hit of all the retailers in the horsemeat scandal, seeing its market share drop below 30% for the first time in eight years and becoming the butt of endless jokes. However, the supermarket is still the most valuable UK retail brand, worth £7.2bn, according to a new report. US consultancy firm Interbrand said the company's brand value lost 2% in the past year, but was still far ahead of second-placed Marks & Spencer, which has also been suffering from poor sales recently despite emerging unscathed from the scandal. M&S's brand was judged to be worth £4.3bn. The biggest riser was Boots, up 16% to £2.2bn, thanks in part to its link with US pharmacy giant Walgreens. In a sign of the changing retail landscape, online clothes seller Asos became the tenth most valuable UK brand, worth £275m, while catalogue business Argos slipped 8% to £533m. Top ten UK retail brands Tesco Brand value: £7.2bn Change: -2% Marks & Spencer Brand value: £4.3bn Change: 5% Boots Brand value: £2.2bn Change: 16% Asda Brand value: £1.1bn Change: 6% Next Brand value: £910m Change: 4% Sainsbury's Brand value: £700m Change: 9% Argos Brand value: £533m Change: -8% Morrisons Brand value: £300m Change: 3% Waitrose Brand value: £284m Change: 12% Asos Brand value: £275m Change: New entry
